review_blob:
On tap at bxl nyc, obvs. Have drank this beer deep into many evenings at my post-bway theater district hang. Rich, fruity, juicy aroma: wonderful, which unfortunately sets up an expectation that isn't exactly lived up to in the flavor. The nose is so interesting but the taste, especially in the finish, falls flat without enough bitterness. Makes it really drinkable as a session beer but not more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

An excellent session pale ale. Extremely drinkable. Not a lot of complicated bullshit. Simple, pleasant, flavorful. Very very enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at 2 Sisters in Bartlesville OK. Cloudy yellow/orange, looks like a blonde or weissbier, light head dissipates quick. Lots of pineapple on the nose, lots of pine in the flavor with mild but present hops. Really fizzy carbonation. Refreshing but not remarkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A sticky sweet IPA. Nose is pungent hoppy and bitter, flavor is totally different. Sweet and sugary. Great color, cloudy bronze. Really creamy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle at Beer Temple in Amsterdam. What to say that hasn't been said... It's never overpowering but still extremely complex. Creamy flavor that lingers a really long time, perfect with some cheese. I can't place the nose or specifics in the flavor but it's damn good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Incredible. A favorite. Balanced, mellow but complex aroma and flavor. Will say more next time I try

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at t'Arendsnest: the "op kruistocht" version. This is the same beer, but aged in white wine barrels. Kills the hoppiness. Peach schnapps very present in the nose and flavor. Served in a ,1L small glass, like a sherry  glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black. Insane stouty nose, like nothing I've ever tasted, extreme stout flavor with licorice and dark chocolate. Small creamy head. Really enjoyed

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at t'Arendsnest. Extremely bitter hoppy nose, with a hint of, dare I say it, sweat socks. But not in a bad way! In a pleasant way. Flavor is just extremely bitter. Large very smooth head. Really enjoyed this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A decent triple, cloudy yellow/gold, good drinkable flavor, citrus and hops in the nose.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good and complex for a kolsch, almost like an IPA... Cloudy with a foamy head. Really good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at de Prael brewery tasting room. really enjoyed this beer: interesting subtle sweet an fruity nose, thick and sticky mouthfeel, very sweet and lots of alcohol coming through. Extremely complex and delicious!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At de zotte, amsterdam: Like a cross between a krieg and a traditional brown dubbel. Love it.

Grimbergen Dubbel on draft at B Cafe NYC.
Great, just as good as in Amsterdam. Hint of cherry krieg vibe, otherwise a dark brown dubbel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quality stuff but disappointing for my palate. Aroma and flavor just seemed burnt without anything else discernible going on. Rusty aftertaste. Greatly prefer other doubles like grimbergen or westmalle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Crazy intense nose. You know what it is? It's cinnamon and nutmeg!!! It sticks with you even as an aftertaste. Creamy nutmeg, this beer should be called. Or clove? Beer people say clove. 
Ok also banana. Huge head that dissolved quickly. Golden but not cloudy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a can at house of brews. Really enjoyed this totally unexpected IPA. No hops in the aroma, more of a chocolate or caramel nose, hard to identify (for me) but not the typical hoptastic McHopPants of current IPAs. Really lovely to sip, not so much a session beer. Slightly cloudy, thin but satisfying head. Will look for again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle at house of brews, 5/2012. Pours pretty light color for an IPA, not cloudy at all, almost like a pale ale, golden with medium head. Lots of bubbles like champagne almost at first, but settled down after a bit. Nose just a really pleasingly intense hoppiness, I'm not getting all the citrus and complexity that other people have mentioned... It just smells like straight hops to me, and tastes the same. Really good though. A great session IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at house of brews 5/2012. All hop on the nose, quite pungent. Pours cloudy golden-orange with very creamy head. Taste is way less intense than expected from the aroma, but the hops are there, especially on the aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Really balanced for a super hopper. 6.9%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank straight from the bottle and didn't overthink it. Just an excellent session beer with no distractions. Nice job, Texas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at BXL
Really light color, soapy head
Nose seemed sour at first, like a lambic, but taste is clearly a strong tripel. Honey, dry on the first taste then a CRAZY aftertaste, bitter and hoppy.
Aftertaste, nose, and flavor all seemed mellower after that first sip, like I got numb to it.
Not super complex. Strong alcohol.
Light, Buzzy carbonation. Pretty drinkable for a 10% booze-fest. Knocked it down with a goat cheese and honey salad... Perfect.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This might be my favorite beer ever. Cloudy amber color. AMAZING aroma, what is it???? Flavor is hoppy and full and delicious. 7%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At de Zotte, Amsterdam. Dark but way less heavy than I expected, the alcohol doesn't come through at all, drinks like water. Awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Moeder Lambic, Brussels. Looks amber, zero head, but tastes like white wine. Sour, bitter, a little funk. Enjoyed but probably wouldn't seek it out.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A mild but sour and totally drinkable Gueuze. Delish. Dare I say a "session gueuze"? Not quite as funky as others but quite enjoyable.

Enjoyed from the bottle at Monk's (Thanks Eddy!)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UNREAL. I can't figure out what this smells like cuz im drunk! Bananas??! It's so funky and delicious, very blonde, carbonation, extremely sour!

From a bottle at Monk's cafe, Philadelphia PA (thanks Eddy!)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Middle of the road, fairly mild gueuze, nice sour nose, very little complexity or aftertaste. Drinkable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A ridiculously intense and complex beer - deep dark reddish brown color, despite being a tripel. Nose is pungent: chocolate, caramel. Thick, smooth, alcohol comes through heavy in the flavor but not in an unpleasant way. A pleasure, to be sipped slowwwwly.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Im not gonna lie, I just happened to pair this with a tube of Paprika-flavored Pringles. Dont judge. Poured from an un-aged bottle into a Westy glass, no head at all. Poured like coca-cola. Like the 12, the aroma is whats truly magical and I dont claim to have the palette to identify but its really wonderful. Darker than I expected, like a typical Belgian Dubbel with a slight cherry color especially held up to light. Definitely has a lively fizz to it. Overall great but not earth-shattering, although Im willing to accept that I dont know what Im talking about just yet. I will drink this again!

Found it at De Bierkoning in Amsterdam.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2012
